evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Continuous data will be summarized using descriptive statistics: the number of observations (n), mean, standard deviation, minimum, median and maximum unless otherwise indicated.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The term “descriptive statistics” refers to the number of patients (n), mean, median, standard deviation (SD), minimum, and maximum for continuous variables
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Continuous variables will be summarized by reporting the number of observations (n), mean, standard deviation, median, minimum, and maximum.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Categorical data will be summarized using numbers and percentages of patients.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Categorical variables will be summarized using frequency tables showing the number and percentage of patients within a particular category.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Categorical variables will be summarized using frequency tables showing the number and percentage of patients within a particular category.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The baseline value for all analyses will be the last non-missing value prior to the first infusion unless otherwise specified.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Baseline Value: Defined as the last non-missing observation (including central laboratory results, vital signs, and tumor assessments) recorded prior to the First Dose Date.

All statements of statistical significance will be based on a two-sided test with an overall level of significance (α) of 0.05... This corresponds to two one-sided tests (TOST) each at the 0.025 significance level.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Missing values in ORR will be considered as ‘Non-responder’ to analyze primary efficacy endpoint.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Patients with no post-baseline tumor assessment or whose response cannot be evaluated (NE) will be treated as non-responders for the primary analysis.
All analyses described in this plan will be performed using SAS v9.4 or higher unless specified otherwise.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP fills in standard detail missing from Original text.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The following patient populations are defined: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population, Per-Protocol (PP) population, PK population, PK population – Maintenance Period Subset and Safety population.
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Analysis Populations referenced throughout this document (Intent-to-Treat, Per-Protocol, Safety, and PK populations) are defined in Section 3.3.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: The following analysis sets will be used... ITT... PP... PK... Safety
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP matches Protocol. Original SAP included an extra subset (PK-Maintenance) not in Protocol, so omitting it is acceptable.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: additional analyses with tipping point analyses will be conducted for the primary efficacy endpoint
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Sensitivity Analysis... Complete Case Analysis... Confirmed vs. Unconfirmed Response... Alternative Covariate Adjustment
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Local review result will be used as supportive data (sensitivity analysis).
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP specifies Tipping Point analysis. Generated SAP specifies different sensitivity analyses (Complete Case, etc.) and omits Tipping Point. Protocol does not mandate Tipping Point, so this is a deviation from Original SAP methodology but not Protocol.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Major protocol deviations include the following: Mis-randomizations... Non-compliance of Inclusion or Exclusion criteria... Significant GCP non-compliance... Receiving any prohibited therapies
evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: A major protocol deviation is one that may affect the interpretation of the primary endpoint and it will be defined in the statistical analysis plan (SAP).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: A major protocol deviation... will be defined in the statistical analysis plan (SAP).
evaluation_table.reasoning: The Generated SAP *is* the SAP, yet it copies the Protocol's future-tense instruction ('will be defined in the SAP') instead of actually defining the deviations. This is a critical failure to fulfill the Protocol's requirement.

evaluation_table.original_sap_text: A sample size of 305 patients per group will provide 80% power to show similarity in efficacy... with an equivalence margin of -12.5 to 12.5
evaluation_table.protocol_text: A sample size of 305 patients per group will provide 80% power...
evaluation_table.reasoning: Sample size calculation is present in both Original SAP and Protocol but missing from Generated SAP.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: mean and median will be presented to one more decimal place than the raw data, and standard deviation will be presented to two more decimal places than the raw data.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Specific rounding rules for summary statistics are missing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Percentages... will be suppressed when the count is zero.
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Formatting rule for zero counts is missing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: A row denoted “Not Done” will be included in count tabulations where necessary
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Formatting rule for missing categorical data is missing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Listings will be sorted by the treatment group and then patient number... and visit
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Specific sorting instructions for listings are missing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: numeric values recorded below the lower limit... will be set to the respective limit for all related summaries
missing_from_generated_sap.description: General rule for handling Limit of Quantification values is missing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: In listings, original results containing inequality sign will be displayed
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Formatting rule for inequality signs is missing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: When combining data from eCRF and analytical facilities discrepancy will be handled as following...
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Rules for reconciling eCRF vs Lab data dates are missing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: The randomization will be balanced by using permuted blocks
missing_from_generated_sap.protocol_text: The randomization will be balanced by using permuted blocks
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Specific randomization method (permuted blocks) is missing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: An Interactive Web Response System (IWRS) will be used for the randomization
missing_from_generated_sap.protocol_text: An interactive voice response system (IVRS) or an interactive web response system (IWRS) will be used
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Details about the randomization system are missing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Data collected on the ‘General Comments’ eCRF page will be presented in a listing
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Instruction to list general comments is missing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: outliers will not be excluded unless they are considered to be erroneous values
missing_from_generated_sap.description: General policy on outlier handling is missing.

missing_from_generated_sap.original_sap_text: Incomplete medications start and stop dates will be imputed as follows...
missing_from_generated_sap.description: Specific algorithms for imputing partial dates (Meds, AEs, Death) are missing.

internal_contradictions.section_a_text: A major protocol deviation... will be defined in the statistical analysis plan (SAP).
internal_contradictions.description: The document refers to itself in the future tense ('will be defined in the SAP') but fails to provide the definitions it promises.

issues.original_sap_text: Major protocol deviations include the following: Mis-randomizations... Non-compliance... GCP non-compliance... Prohibited therapies...
issues.generated_sap_text: A major protocol deviation... will be defined in the statistical analysis plan (SAP).
issues.protocol_text: A major protocol deviation... will be defined in the statistical analysis plan (SAP).
issues.why_they_conflict: The Generated SAP copies the Protocol's instruction to define deviations in the SAP, but fails to actually define them. The Original SAP correctly defines them.
issues.description: Failure to define Major Protocol Deviations as required by Protocol.
issues.reasoning: The Generated SAP acts as the SAP but fails to contain the content the Protocol assigns to it, instead just repeating the assignment instruction.

extra_information_flagged.detail: Generated SAP includes detailed visit windowing rules not present in Original SAP Section 4 (though implied by Appendix).

reasoning: The Generated SAP fails in a critical area: it does not define Major Protocol Deviations. The Protocol explicitly states these 'will be defined in the SAP'. The Original SAP fulfills this by listing them (Mis-randomization, etc.). The Generated SAP merely copies the Protocol's text saying they 'will be defined in the SAP', creating a circular reference and failing to provide the required definitions. Additionally, the Generated SAP omits the Sample Size calculation and specific Randomization details (permuted blocks) which are present in the Protocol. It also changes the sensitivity analysis strategy from Tipping Point (Original) to Complete Case (Generated), which is a methodological downgrade.
summary: The Generated SAP is rated POOR due to a critical failure to define Major Protocol Deviations, a requirement explicitly deferred to the SAP by the Protocol. Instead of defining them, the document copies the Protocol's instruction that they 'will be defined', leaving them undefined. It also omits the Sample Size calculation and Randomization details found in the Protocol.
